name: Iso8601_timezone
documentation:
ISO8601 timezone string, in format:

* `Z | ±hh[mm]`

where:

* `hh` is "00" - "23" (0-filled to two digits)
* `mm` is "00" - "59" (0-filled to two digits)
* `Z` is a literal meaning UTC (modern replacement for GMT), i.e. timezone `+0000`

hour.name: hour
hour.documentation: Extract the hour part of timezone, as an Integer in the range `00 - 14`.

minute.name: minute
minute.documentation: Extract the hour part of timezone, as an Integer, usually either 0 or 30.

sign.name: sign
sign.documentation: Direction of timezone expresssed as +1 or -1.

is_partial.name: is_partial
is_partial.documentation: True if this time zone is partial, i.e. if minutes is missing.

is_extended.name: is_extended
is_extended.documentation: True if this time-zone uses ‘:’ separators.

is_gmt.name: is_gmt
is_gmt.documentation: True if timezone is UTC, i.e. `+0000`.

as_string.name: as_string
as_string.documentation: Return timezone string in extended format.

invariants.Min_hour_valid: sign = -1 implies hour > 0 and hour <= Min_timezone_hour
invariants.Max_hour_valid: sign = 1 implies hour > 0 and hour <= Max_timezone_hour
